item.title: [IWP] Promoter Mr. Krishna Kumar Mohta Acquires 0.043% Shares in The Indian Wood Products Company Ltd
item.description:
On 27.02.2026, Mr. Krishna Kumar Mohta, a promoter of The Indian Wood Products Company Ltd, has acquired 27724 equity shares of the company from the open market. item.title: [ZENITHEXPO] Zenith Exports Ltd Fined Rs. 3,95,300 for Violating SEBI LODR Regulations
item.description:
Zenith Exports Ltd has received an email from the Stock Exchange regarding a penalty imposed on the company for violating Regulation 17(1) of the SEBI LODR Regulations, 2015. The company has been fined Rs. 3,95,300 (Rs. 3,35,000 plus 18% GST) by both BSE and NSE. The fine is for non-compliance during the quarter ended 31st December 2025. The company is in the process of submitting request letters for waiver of the fine to both stock exchanges.

  • Zenith Exports Ltd fined Rs. 3,95,300 for violating SEBI LODR Regulations
  • The fine is for non-compliance during the quarter ended 31st December 2025
  • The company has received notices from BSE and NSE
  • The company is in the process of submitting request letters for waiver of the fine to both stock exchanges
  • There is no material impact on the company's financials, operations, or other activities

item.title: [SHBAJRG] Shri Bajrang Alliance Ltd Reduces Partnership Interest in Shri Bajrang Chemical Distillery LLP
item.description:
Shri Bajrang Alliance Ltd has reconstituted its partnership interest in its associate, Shri Bajrang Chemical Distillery LLP. The reconstitution has resulted in a reduction of the Companyâ€™s partnership interest from 30% to 16%. This has been done to optimize capital allocation, enhance liquidity and financial flexibility, reduce long-term capital commitment and contingent exposures, align investments with core business priorities, and enable redeployment of capital towards expansion of principal operating segments. The reconstitution does not involve any sale to a third party and has been effected internally among existing promoter-group partners. The transaction is not expected to affect control of the LLP.

item.title: [MEGASOFT] Sigma Advanced Systems Faces Fine for Non-Compliance with SEBI Regulations on Board Composition
item.description:
Sigma Advanced Systems Ltd. has received emails from BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India Limited, imposing a fine of Rs. 4,83,800 each for non-compliance with Regulation 17(1) of SEBI listing regulations. The non-compliance pertains to the composition of the board, having fallen short of one director. However, the company has already complied with the requirement by appointing Mr. Cheemarla Damodar Reddy as Additional Director. The fine will be paid in compliance with the applicable SEBI listing regulations and circulars.

  • Sigma Advanced Systems received emails from BSE Limited and National Stock Exchange of India Limited imposing a fine for non-compliance with Regulation 17(1) of SEBI listing regulations.
  • The non-compliance is regarding the composition of the board, with the company falling short of one director.
  • The company has already complied with the requirement by appointing Mr. Cheemarla Damodar Reddy as Additional Director.
  • The fine imposed by each exchange is Rs. 4,83,800.

item.title: [BHARTIARTL] Bharti Airtel Faces Penalties Totaling Rs. 2,53,000 for Subscriber Verification Norms Violation
item.description:
Bharti Airtel Ltd. has disclosed receiving notices from the Department of Telecommunications (DoT) in Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh (East) Licence Service Areas (LSA) imposing penalties for alleged violation of subscriber verification norms. The Madhya Pradesh LSA notice imposes a penalty of Rs. 1,44,000, while the Uttar Pradesh (East) LSA notice imposes a penalty of Rs. 1,09,000, totaling Rs. 2,53,000. The notices were received on February 27, 2026. The company has opted to pay the penalties instead of contesting them.

  • Bharti Airtel received notices from the Department of Telecommunications in Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh (East) Licence Service Areas (LSA).
  • The notices were for alleged violation of subscriber verification norms.
  • The Madhya Pradesh LSA notice imposes a penalty of Rs. 1,44,000, while the Uttar Pradesh (East) LSA notice imposes a penalty of Rs. 1,09,000.
  • The company has opted to pay the penalties instead of contesting them.
  • The notices were received on February 27, 2026.
